title: I hope these ADC changes are backfiring in your face Rito.
body:
Pretty ridiculous playing a game against bruisers but that's meta it seems. I've played so many games just watching people instalock non-adc champs just because you ruined them. There are still some players choosing an ADC champ because that is their main probably, but lets be real... even if that ADC gets fed, champions like Darius still somehow control the game much harder after 20 minutes. It's almost hilarious. 

Just revert these damn changes you've made and leave it be. This has to be such a big fucking hick-up I wouldn't be surprised if you just forfeit ties with WAY more players than the common quitter.

Mordekaiser has never been viable botlane even though his whole kit revolved around being botlane, so you couldn't have gotten a worse example if you tried. People preferred to take him toplane even though it meant losing on the exp inflation and the dragon ghost, that should tell you how much he sucked botlane. You could find examples of people playing weird things since ever, doesn't mean those things were ever viable.

Also you're ignoring how the items those ADCs relied were deliberately gutted early, with IE being given a deliberate awkward buildpath specifically for this reason. An ADC needs to farm before backing for longer and the items they do purchase offer less of a powerspike to booth. And if they are forced to back before having the that higher amount of gold they have to go back to lane with less stats than before, which makes having a bad early game even worse. Hence why their winrates dropped all across the board.

Just another example of you being horribly informed/experienced.

Mordekaiser was the friggin original abuser of dual support item bots. Adcs only picked it up after they began seeing Morde go bot and abuse dual relic shields to heal up the lane.

Kalista's been getting {{item:3153}} all along.

I even First item {{item:3156}} or {{item:3071}} on Jinx..... and go 20 KDA games. 

If you can't figure out the new build path. That's okay. it's still there. Just play something else until someone else discovers it for you.

That isn't the issue though. "Off-meta" selections are suppose to be exactly that, not "oh, adc sucks so bad right now, let's make Darius the new meta." Idc if you play someone else as an ADC that wasn't originally suppose to be adc, but I do care when it extremely interferes with the winrate of almost the WHOLE role.
